titleStmt.title: William Fitch to James F. Robinson
CWG7912

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
WILLIAM FITCH,
ATTORNEY FOR CLAIMANTS,
CORNER OF SEVENTH AND F STREETS, WASHINGTON CITY, D. C.
SPECIAL REFERENCE BY PERMISSION:
HON. RICHARD WALLACH, Mayor of Washington, D. C.
HON W. W. SEATON, Ex-Mayor of Washington, D. C.
LEWIS JOHNSON & CO., Bankers, Washington, D. C.
EX-GOV. HUNT, of Lockport, New York.
JUDGE GARDINER, of Lockport, New York
HON. JOHN GANSON, State Senator, Buffalo, New York.
HON. BURT VANHORN, Member of Congress from New York
HON. GEO. W. CLINTON, Judge Superior Court, Buffalo, N. Y.
MESSERS. HUBBLE & DAVIS, Counselors, Buffalo, N. Y.
JUDGE BOWEN, of Lockport, New York.
JUDGE WOODS, of Lockport, New York.
HON. T. T. FLAGLER, Ex-member of Congress from New York
HON. JOHN GANSON, President of the New York and Erie Bank, Buffalo, New York

Washington, March 13 1863
To his Excellency James F. Robinson
Governor of State of Kentucky.
Sir,

Enclosed I take the liberty of sending you an Sworn Copy of a recommendation Signed by members of the Thirty Seventh Congress with a view of obtaining the appointment of commissioner of Deeds for your State in this District
Hoping my application may receive your Excellenc'y's. favorable attention

I am
Very Respectfully,
William Fitch
WILLIAM FITCH
WASHINGTON,
D. C.
NOTARY PUBLIC
